page.title: 11Communications in Saxilby
page.content: Saxilby Post Office is situated at 39/41 High Street and provides a counter service for the village and is the main delivery centre for the surrounding area. There is a sorting office at the Post Office which accomodates nine postal delivery staff who are employed by the Post Office, two full-time and seven part-time. Three mail vans and one moped are used for the rural deliveries, plus cycles for the village rounds, and all are garaged on the premises. The counter service is the sole responsibility of the Sub-Postmaster, who employs four part-time assistants to serve both Post Office and shop customers. The main services are the encashment of pensions and allowances and the work of the National Girobank, which is the main growth business for the Post Office at the present time.
